intro: Hieracium kraettlii, commonly known as the Kraettili's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium kraettlii is often found in open habitats and is considered a characteristic species of calcareous grasslands.
